media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan creating โartificial obstaclesโ to normalization deal, Armenia charges
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armeniaโs top diplomat accused Azerbaijan of creating โnew artificial obstaclesโ as yearslong efforts to reach a normalization deal appear to remain stalled. ๐ Armenia will receive nearly $11 million in military aid from the European Union after Hungary lifted its veto, Radio Azatutyun reported, citing unnamed diplomatic sources. ๐ Armeniaโs prime minister said he โgreatly values the role of the United States in the peace-building process in our regionโ in a July 4 letter to the U.S. president. ๐ Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T_ys80vOdII ๐ Renowned historian Ronald Grigor Suny on โPashinyanโs ruthless dilemma:โ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bc7NLr7caTI

media:group.media:title: Who lost Artsakh?
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian analyzes Secretary of Armenia's National Security Councilโs comments last week regarding the challenges Armenia faced last year. He also takes an in-depth look at what factors led to the ethnic cleansing of Artsakh and the widespread displacement of Armenians. Furthermore, Hacopian helps apportion responsibility for the outcome to key players and outlines reforms to prevent future issues.

entry.title: Uncertainties mount in bordering Kirants amid border demarcation

media:group.media:title: Uncertainties mount in bordering Kirants amid border demarcation
media:group.media:description:
After a period of anti-government protests in Armeniaโs Tavush region, the sound of border construction is now heard again. In May, residents in Kirants village, bordering Azerbaijan, took to the streets to protest Yerevanโs border delimitation and demarcation process, which includes the handing over of vital roads, bridges, and farmland to Azerbaijan. The demarcation has already split part of Kirants village and has led to the evacuation of a number of residents. CivilNet is in the region to understand the impact of this process on people.

media:group.media:description:
ี ีธีฉ ีฟีกึีธึึ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ ีถีกีพีฉีกีตีซีถ ีฐีซีดีถีกีฏีกีถี ิฑีฆีฅึีซ-ีีซึีกีฃ-ิณีตีธึีถีฅีทีฌีซ (ิฑีิณ) ีฐีกีถึีจ ีคีกีฟีกึีฏีพีฅีฌีธึ ีง, ีซีถีนีถ ีงีฌ ีฏีกึีธีฒ ีง ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีถีธึ ีบีกีฟีฅึีกีฆีดีซ ีบีกีฟีณีกีผ ีคีกีผีถีกีฌโค ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด ีถีทีธึีด ีง ีฟีถีฟีฅีฝีกีฃีฅีฟ, ีฐีฅีฟีกีฆีธีฟีธีฒ ีีกีฐึีกีด ีึีกีฆีตีกีถีจึ ีีก ีธึีฝีธึีดีถีกีฝีซึีฅีฌ ีง ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ ีถีกีพีฉีซ ึ ีขีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฃีกีฆีซ ีกึีคีตีธึีถีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจี ีคีซีฟีกึีฏีฅีฌีธีพ ีถีกีพีฉีกีตีซีถ ีผีฅีฝีธึึีฝีถีฅึีซ ีฝีบีกีผีดีกีถ ีฐีฅีฟึีกีถึีถีฅึีถ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ ีฟีถีฟีฅีฝีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกึ ึ ีคึีกีถีซึ ีขีญีธีฒ ีกีฆีคีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถ ีกึีฟีกึีซีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ, ีดีกีฝีถีกีพีธึีกีบีฅีฝ, ีฐีกีต-ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธีถึีฌีซีฏีฟีซ ีพึีกึ

entry.title: Armenia in โsubstantiveโ talks with US to replace aging nuclear plant

media:group.media:title: Armenia in โsubstantiveโ talks with US to replace aging nuclear plant
media:group.media:description:
๐ It remains unclear if the top diplomats of Armenia and Azerbaijan will hold another round of talks on the sidelines of next weekโs NATO summit in Washington. ๐ Security chief Armen Grigoryan indicated that Armenia plans to pivot away from Russia to the United States as it seeks a replacement for its aging nuclear power plant. ๐ Armenia opened a criminal probe on suspicion of incitement to suicide after one service member died of a gunshot wound overnight, the countryโs latest non-combat army death. ๐ A bipartisan congressional delegation arrived in Yerevan from Washington for talks with Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and other senior Armenian officials.

entry.title: Pashinyan's Ruthless Dilemma: A Talk With Ronald Suny

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan's Ruthless Dilemma: A Talk With Ronald Suny
media:group.media:description:
Ronald Grigor Suny, Distinguished University Professor of History at the University of Michigan, Emeritus Professor of Political Science and History at the University of Chicago, and Senior Researcher at the National Research University โ Higher School of Economics in Saint Petersburg, Russia, sits down with CivilNetโs Eric Hacopian to talk about Armeniaโs domestic and regional challenges.
Professor Suny holds Russia responsible for betraying Armenia during the ethnic cleansing of Nagorno-Karabakh in 2023, and criticizes the U.S. for not taking practical steps to prevent autocratic Azerbaijanโs aggression against the democratic Armenian enclave.
